findings.title: Inclusion of Fallback function is Redundant
findings.description: The token contract includes a fallback function which simply reverts whenever it is triggered, making the payment rejection process inadequate.

findings.title: Arithmetic Operations might lead to Integer Overflow or Underflow
findings.description: The token contract doesnâ€™t use the SafeMath library and implements arithmetic operations simply, which could lead to an Arithmetic Overflow or Underflow exploit scenario.

findings.title: Redundant Require Statements
findings.description: The transferFrom function in the token contract includes redundant require statements to check the sender and receiver addresses.

findings.title: External visibility should be preferred
findings.description: Functions that are never called throughout the contract should be marked as external visibility instead of public visibility for gas optimization.

findings.title: Absence of Error messages in Require Statements
findings.description: No require statement in the contract includes an error message, making it difficult to detect the reason behind a particular function revert.

findings.title: Compiler Version is not Fixed
findings.description: The compiler version in the contract file is not fixed, which is considered bad practice.
